page.title: 06Police in Skegness
page.content: The building of the police station was started in 1973 and was finished in 1974. The official opening was 18th March 1974. The old police station was where Social Services is now standing on Roman Bank. The new police station is a building on Park Avenue and is the tallest building in Skegness.The pay of the first police constables was 75p a week. In 1929 they were getting paid Â£1.05 then in 1938 it went up to Â£4.47 a week. Altogether there are ten cells,6 for men,2 for women and 2 for juveniles. The police have 3 police cars out in the summer and 2 in winter. In the police station there are two dog kennels.In Skegness the most trouble occurs on Bank Holidays and there are 5 in a year, but 26 to 30 more men come to patrol the streets.
